title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 December 2016 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu> has quit  
01:50 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
06:48 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
07:55 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
09:10 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <ol-ow2> Hi, i would like use in GROOVY thios: Arrays.copyOfRange(oldArray, startIndex, endIndex); need i import something ? if yes how ? tmortagne  
11:51 <ol-ow2> this\*  
11:51 <tmortagne> ol-ow2: groovy macro is included by default in XWiki  
11:52 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Groovy+Macro  
11:52 <ol-ow2> :D  
11:52 <ol-ow2> it's not my question, sorry  
11:53 <ol-ow2> BUT Arrays.copyOfRange(oldArray, startIndex, endIndex);  
11:54 <ol-ow2> how can i call this one, in groovy ?  
11:55 <ol-ow2> hum.. a minutes  
11:56 <ol-ow2> may be a mistake from my part  
12:00 <ol-ow2> Caused by: groovy.lang.MissingMethodException: No signature of method: static java.util.Arrays.copyOfRange() is applicable for argument types: (java.util.ArrayList, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Integer)  
12:00 <ol-ow2> i'm getting this error  
12:00 <ol-ow2> has quit  
12:01 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
12:07 <ol-ow2> .  
12:54 <edvorg> has quit  
12:58 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:34 <ClemensR> has quit  
13:57 <muferro> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <muferro> Hello guys, how can i work with one Skins for each Spaces  in a same instance xwiki? ex: skin1 for space1, skin2 for space2, skin3 for space  
14:05 <ol-ow2> dynamiccally ?  
14:07 <tmortagne> muferro: you can set the skin in the space administration UI  
14:07 <tmortagne> same as a wiki  
14:08 <tmortagne> if your question is "how do I set the skin programmatically" then the skin is set in a XWiki.XWikiPreference object in the page <space>.WebPreferences  
14:20 <muferro> how can i acces <space>.WebPreferences  
14:21 <ol-ow2> space = $doc.space  
14:21 <ol-ow2> where doc is the current doc  
14:22 <ol-ow2> so "set( $currentPref="${doc.space}.WebPreferences")  
14:22 <ol-ow2> -" + #  
14:23 <ol-ow2> #set \*  
14:40 <muferro> you have a tutorial?  
14:40 <muferro> sorry i dont understand  
14:44 <Pbas> Hello, here a way to access object in a page: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/APIGuide#HAccessobjectsinapage  
15:56 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
16:22 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:38 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
17:23 <ClemensR> has quit  
17:46 <Pbas> has quit
